name: Atsushi Igarashi
content: Atsushi IGARASHI Professor, D.Sc. Atsushi IGARASHI Japanese Contents: Research Publication List, Research Talks Courses Contact Information Dept. of Informatics Graduate School of Informatics, Kyoto University Yoshida-Honmachi, Sakyo-ku Kyoto 606-8501, Japan Phone: +81-75-753-4953 email: igarashi@kuis.kyoto-u.ac.jp News Upcoming Events FTfJP 2025 (06/2025; PC member) APLAS 2025 (10/2025; PC member) FM 2026 (05/2026; PC member) Recent Past Events About Myself I am a Professor at Dept. of Communication and Computer Engineering, Graduate School of Informatics, Kyoto University. I received my B.S., M.S., and D.S. (equivalent to PhD in the Japanese system) degrees from Department of Information Science, University of Tokyo in 1995, 1997, and 2000, respectively. Formerly, I belonged to Dept. of Graphics and Computer Science, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, University of Tokyo and Dept. of Intelligence Science and Technology, Graduate School of Informatics, Kyoto University. My current major research interests are in principles of programming languages. In particular, I'm interested in type systems, type inference, concurrent/distributed programming languages, type theoretic foundations for object-oriented languages. My research papers are available here. I was visiting Department of Computer Science, Indiana University from June 1998 to July 1998 and Department of Computer and Information Science, University of Pennsylvania from July 1998 to March 2000 under supervision of Prof. Benjamin Pierce. Other interests are in mathematics, music, playing the guitar, etc. Last update on $Date:: 2025-04-05 15:28:47 +0900 #$
